roleset.name: create

example.name: make-v: basic transitive
example.text: Loews Corp makes Kent cigarettes .

example.name: make-v: passive, source as of-phrase
example.text: Those chips are made of gallium arsenide .

example.name: make-v: mincemeat pie
example.text: But the surprisingly durable seven - year economic expansion has made mincemeat of more than one forecast .

propbank.arg: the surprisingly durable seven - year economic expansion

example.name: making-n: Arg 1 only
example.text: the making of an engine disk

example.name: making-n: arg 0 (because arg 1 is outside the span)
example.text: a wooden block of his making

example.name: making-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: the image making of the cosmetic trades

example.name: making-n: arg 1
example.text: He plays an active role in policy making .

roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00060. Comparison to 'make-n' and 'make.01-v'. VN class build-26.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from making.01-n)
MAKE-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'make.01'. VN class build-26.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from make.01-n)
This usage is extremely rare, if it exists at all. Given that there is now a separate roleset for 'making', all such instances should appear under that lemma. (from make.01-n)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: This name has made the spotted leopard a common motif for costume jewelry .

propbank.arg: the spotted leopard a common motif for costume jewelry

example.name: make-v: nominal small clause
example.text: Financial problems make them unattractive takeover targets .

example.name: make-v: adjectival small clause
example.text: Asian nations ' memories make them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony .

propbank.arg: them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony

example.name: make-v: with tough-movement
example.text: SC Law makes it a crime to breach test security .

propbank.arg: it a crime to breach test security

example.name: make-v: cause to be
example.text: For Zel Herring , owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe , a tin building in midtown , all this has made for a very good year .

propbank.arg: For Zel Herring , owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe , a tin building in midtown

example.name: make-v: make sure
example.text: We will do everything we can to make sure that he shows up at his court date there .

propbank.arg: sure that he shows up at his court date there

roleset.name: earn cash or wages, earning

example.name: make-v: make a quick buck
example.text: If Bill Gates made a nickel every time Windows crashed ... oh wait , he does .

example.name: make-v: job as for-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money for what she does .

example.name: make-v: job as as-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money as Penn 's president .

example.name: make-v: All args
example.text: I do n't see anything wrong with this speech and his making a living doing what he 's doing here or going after the audience he has here in this video .

roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on make-v.05. No corresponding VNcls. (from making.03-n)

example.name: make-v: take that, eh?
example.text: Americans make better fishermen .

example.name: make-v
example.text: Overcome by hunger pains Sellers would eat massive amounts of food and then throw it up to make weight .

example.name: make-v
example.text: Some other stories making headlines right now .

example.name: make-v
example.text: We made the finish line !

roleset.name: "way" construction: make one's way, travel

example.name: make-v: All arguments
example.text: Hundreds of Californians made their way to their computers after the quake , and checked in with each other on electronic bulletin boards , which link computers CB - radio - style , via phone lines .

roleset.note: MAKE-V NOTES: Doesn't fit with any other sense, unavoidable, although it seems inappropriate to have a roleset/sense for a construction that is productive with many verbs: She danced/wiggled/laughed/cheated her way... (from make.19-v)

roleset.name: interpret, have an understanding of

example.name: make-v
example.text: Make of it what you will , wo n't hurt me none .

roleset.note: MAKE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

roleset.name: light verb
roleset.note: MAKE-V NOTES: The original light verb frames make.03 and make.04 have been collapsed into this frame. (from make.LV-v). Combines with: decision, comment, cut, choice,determination, distinction, etc.

roleset.name: comprise, build, structure

example.name: make_up-v: passivized
example.text: 40 % of the homeless population is made up of women and children .

example.name: make_up-v: corresponding active
example.text: Women and children make up 40 % of the homeless population

example.name: make_up-v: args 1 &2
example.text: Scientists have suspected there must be something different about the genetic make - up of diabetics who develop complications ;

roleset.note: MAKE_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, make_up-v.07. Corresponds to VNcls build-26.1. (from make.02-n)

example.name: make_up-v: basic transitive
example.text: Make up your own mind on the issue .

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: I was surprised that Sharon had made up with him

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The Chinese folk charms of financial good fortune have a great variety of origins , an abundance that is due in large part to the Chinese people 's virtuosity at making things up as they go along .

roleset.name: catch up, do at a later date after having missed

role.descr: entity which is behind in something (eg payments)

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: In Cuba though , where President Castro had his country sit out last year 's revelry , they 'll be making up for it as major festivities are set .

propbank.arg: where President Castro had his country sit out last year 's revelry

example.name: make_up-v: instrumental agent
example.text: Some Democrats , led by Rep. Jack Brooks ( D. , Texas ) , unsuccessfully opposed the measure because they fear that the fees may not fully make up for the budget cuts .

roleset.name: discern

example.name: make_out-v: typical usage?
example.text: I ca n't make out the handwriting on this letter .

roleset.note: (I haven't actually seen any of these in WSJ, but who knows?) (from make.12-v)

example.name: make_out-v: Imperative
example.text: Please make out the check to " AT & T "

example.name: make_out-v: getting by
example.text: At his new job , as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick , Herrington & Sutcliffe , he will make out much better .

propbank.arg: At his new job , as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick , Herrington & Sutcliffe

roleset.name: describe, make it seem like

role.descr: secondary attribute; what arg1 is made to seem like

example.name: make_out-v: All args. Arg2= like
example.text: You make it out like hampering a nation 's development is somthing new !

propbank.arg: like hampering a nation 's development is somthing new

example.name: make_out-v: All args
example.text: But an agressive opposition , along with a biased press and press with an agenda make them out to be a lot worse than they are .

propbank.arg: an agressive opposition , along with a biased press and press with an agenda
to be a lot worse than they are

example.name: make_out-v: Arg1 as sentential complement
example.text: The University made out it was much better than it seems .

propbank.arg: it was much better than it seems

roleset.note: MAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. See VNcls characterize-29.2. Comparison to 'describe'. (from make.23-v)

roleset.name: french kiss

example.name: make_out-v: When both participants are in one arg, use arg 0
example.text: We was just making out !

example.name: ARG1
example.text: I made out with 10 strangers to find love .

roleset.note: MAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Based on Bolt SMS data. Comparison with kiss.01, but minus the arg 2 for secondary predication (*I made out with him goodbye). No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from make.26-v)

example.name: make_it-v: without destination
example.text: The governor could n't make it , so the lieutenant governor welcomed the special guests .

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Meanwhile , the ROC table tennis team twice made it to the finals , but fell just short of the gold each time .

example.name: make_it-v: if I can make it there, I'll make it anywhere
example.text: Mike Huber , a roustabout , is even making it in his new career as an entrepreneur .

propbank.arg: in his new career as an entrepreneur

example.name: make_off-v: bank robbers
example.text: When he initially refused , he says , they stabbed him in the back and made off with $ 2,000 and 280 blank tickets .

roleset.name: rework or revamp, renovate

role.descr: end state, made over into what?

example.name: make_over-v: from a google search
example.text: The following year , Clarence Rowland , then managing the Sox , made him over into an outfielder and farmed him out to the Milwaukee American Association Club .

propbank.arg: Clarence Rowland , then managing the Sox

example.name: make_over-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: She professionally and diligently executed her make over of my home through the use of additional furnishings and accessories which she provided .

example.name: make_over-n: Oooh La La!
example.text: August was especially special because of two things : First , Clinton Street would get her make - over of fresh tar and pea gravel in early August ( maybe late July ) .

propbank.arg: of fresh tar and pea gravel

example.name: make_over-n: another args1 and 2
example.text: The bride to be had a 5 star service and she loved her make - over of sultry orange russet tones to complement her skin tone .

propbank.arg: of sultry orange russet tones to complement her skin tone

roleset.note: MAKE_OVER-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls. (from make.03-n)

roleset.name: nominal version of light verb

role.descr: maker, subject of light verbish noun

example.name: making-n: True predicate only - decision making
example.text: The key to the creation of the `` organic '' state lay in the formation of `` natural '' groups that would undertake the role of decision - making .

example.name: making-n: With argMs - decision making
example.text: Still , case - by - case retrospective decision making of this sort is vulnerable to the tunnel vision caused by a fixation on ad hoc -LRB- and usually sleazy -RRB- examples .

example.name: making-n: With argMs plan-making
example.text: Strategic spatial plan - making is thus a process through which knowledge and value , rules and procedures are actively mobilized .

example.name: making-n: True predicate only - offer making
example.text: The basic principle behind offer making is to try to get a better deal .

roleset.note: MAKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on usages in nouns-00060 project. No relevant VN cls. Framed by Claire (from making.02-n)

This roleset should only be used for cases where 'making' acts as a light verb and the object of 'making' is also an eventive, predicating noun. Use argMs for all other arguments-- these cannot be predicted because they are related to the true predicate rather than 'making'. (from making.02-n)
